definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia

sentences.english: The driver clapped on his brakes and the car came to a screeching halt.
sentences.chinese: 司機急忙踩剎車，車子嗄地一聲停住了。

sentences.english: Chooses to the demon, flow, it is the legendary name.
sentences.chinese: 空明千流，對諸妖來說，似傳說中地名字嗄。

sentences.english: So you want to go to work for us, eh?
He liked to hear the sound of the snow crunching under his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡聽腳下白雪發出的嗄吱嗄吱的聲音。

sentences.english: He liked to hear the sound of the snow crunching under his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡聽腳下白雪發出的嗄吱嗄吱的聲音。

sentences.english: Two in the Muni Gou the end, and Zakho A waterfall is separated by only one mountain.
sentences.chinese: 二道海在牟尼溝的末端，和扎嗄瀑布僅一山之隔。

sentences.english: But if you wanna cry. Cry on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 俺地肩膀沒寬，但似，還似能讓你靠着嗄。

sentences.english: Constant flashing light, in the blink, is near overcrowded. Monster.
sentences.chinese: 光芒沒斷閃動，眨眼間，附近就妖滿爲患嗄。

definition: move the mouth as in speaking
onomat. for surprise, amazement and sigh
to treat well/to detain/variant of 款[kuan3]
